00092 typedef unsigned long xnarch_cpumask_t;
00093 #define xnarch_num_online_cpus()         XNARCH_NR_CPUS
00094 #define xnarch_cpu_online_map            ((1<<xnarch_num_online_cpus()) - 1)
00095 #define xnarch_cpu_set(cpu, mask)        ((mask) |= 1 << (cpu))
00096 #define xnarch_cpu_clear(cpu, mask)      ((mask) &= 1 << (cpu))
00097 #define xnarch_cpus_clear(mask)          ((mask) = 0UL)
00098 #define xnarch_cpu_isset(cpu, mask)      (!!((mask) & (1 << (cpu))))
00099 #define xnarch_cpus_and(dst, src1, src2) ((dst) = (src1) & (src2))
00100 #define xnarch_cpus_equal(mask1, mask2)  ((mask1) == (mask2))
00101 #define xnarch_cpus_empty(mask)          ((mask) == 0UL)
00102 #define xnarch_cpumask_of_cpu(cpu)       (1 << (cpu)) 
00103 #define xnarch_first_cpu(mask)           (ffnz(mask))
00104 #define XNARCH_CPU_MASK_ALL              (~0UL)
00105 
00106 #define xnarch_ullmod(ull,uld,rem)   ((*rem) = ((ull) % (uld)))
00107 #define xnarch_uldivrem(ull,uld,rem) ((u_long)xnarch_ulldiv((ull),(uld),(rem)))
00108 #define xnarch_uldiv(ull, d)         xnarch_uldivrem(ull, d, NULL)
00109 #define xnarch_ulmod(ull, d)         ({ u_long _rem;                    \
00110                                         xnarch_uldivrem(ull,d,&_rem); _rem; })
00111 
00112 static inline int xnarch_imuldiv(int i, int mult, int div)
00113 {
00114     unsigned long long ull = (unsigned long long) (unsigned) i * (unsigned) mult;
00115     return ull / (unsigned) div;
00116 }
00117 
00118 static inline unsigned long long __xnarch_ullimd(unsigned long long ull,
00119                                                  u_long m,
00120                                                  u_long d) {
00121 
00122     unsigned long long mh, ml;
00123     u_long h, l, mlh, mll, qh, r, ql;
00124 
00125     h = ull >> 32; l = ull & 0xffffffff; /* Split ull. */
00126     mh = (unsigned long long) h * m;
00127     ml = (unsigned long long) l * m;
00128     mlh = ml >> 32; mll = ml & 0xffffffff; /* Split ml. */
00129     mh += mlh;
00130     qh = mh / d;
00131     r = mh % d;
00132     ml = (((unsigned long long) r) << 32) + mll; /* assemble r and mll */
00133     ql = ml / d;
00134 
00135     return (((unsigned long long) qh) << 32) + ql;
00136 }
00137 
00138 static inline long long xnarch_llimd(long long ll, u_long m, u_long d) {
00139     if(ll < 0)
00140         return -__xnarch_ullimd(-ll, m, d);
00141     return __xnarch_ullimd(ll, m, d);
00142 }
00143 
00144 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ullmul(unsigned long m1,
00145                                                unsigned long m2) {
00146     return (unsigned long long) m1 * m2;
00147 }
00148 
00149 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ulldiv (unsigned long long ull,
00150                                                 unsigned long uld,
00151                                                 unsigned long *rem)
00152 {
00153     if (rem)
00154         *rem = ull % uld;
00155 
00156     return ull / uld;
00157 }

00166 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00167 
00168     const char *name;           /* Symbolic name of thread (can be NULL) */
00169     struct xnthread *thread;    /* VM thread pointer (opaque) */
00170     void *khandle;              /* Kernel handle (opaque) */
00171     void (*entry)(void *);      /* Thread entry */
00172     void *cookie;               /* Thread cookie passed on entry */
00173     int imask;                  /* Initial interrupt mask */
00174     jmp_buf rstenv;             /* Restart context info */
00175     pthread_t thid;
00176     xncompletion_t completion;
00177 
00178 } xnarchtcb_t;

00202 static inline int __attribute__ ((unused))
00203 xnarch_read_environ (const char *name, const char **ptype, void *pvar)
00204 
00205 {
00206     char *value;
00207 
00208     if (*ptype == NULL)
00209         return 0;       /* Already read in */
00210 
00211     value = getenv(name);
00212 
00213     if (!value)
00214         return -1;
00215 
00216     if (**ptype == 's')
00217         *((char **)pvar) = value;
00218     else if (strstr(*ptype,"int"))
00219         *((int *)pvar) = atoi(value);
00220     else if (strstr(*ptype,"long"))
00221         *((u_long *)pvar) = (u_long)atol(value);
00222 
00223     *ptype = NULL;
00224 
00225     return 1;
00226 }
00227 
00228 static inline int xnarch_lock_irq (void)
00229 {
00230     return xnarch_atomic_xchg(&uvm_irqlock,1);
00231 }
00232 
00233 static inline void xnarch_unlock_irq (int x)
00234 {
00235     extern unsigned long uvm_irqpend;
00236 
00237     if (!x && uvm_irqlock)
00238         {
00239         if (xnarch_atomic_xchg(&uvm_irqpend,0))
00240             uvm_thread_release(&uvm_irqlock);
00241         else
00242             uvm_irqlock = 0;
00243         }
00244 }

00256 #ifdef XENO_INTR_MODULE
00257 
00258 unsigned long uvm_irqlock = 0;  /* =1 whenever IRQs are off. */
00259 
00260 unsigned long uvm_irqpend = 0;  /* =1 whenever IRQs are pending. */
00261 
00262 void xnarch_sync_irq (void) /* Synchronization point for IRQ servers. */
00263 
00264 {
00265     if (uvm_irqlock)
00266         /* IRQs are off. Set the IRQ pending flag and go to sleep,
00267            waiting for the IRQs to be unmasked. */
00268         uvm_thread_hold(&uvm_irqpend);
00269 }
00270

00272                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00273                                                    void *cookie),
00274                                    int (*ackfn)(unsigned irq),
00275                                    void *cookie)
00276 {
00277     return -ENOSYS;
00278 }

00333 static void xnarch_restart_handler (int sig) {
00334 
00335     longjmp(uvm_current->rstenv,1);
00336 }
00337 
00338 int main (int argc, char *argv[])
00339 
00340 {
00341     struct sigaction sa;
00342     int err;
00343 
00344     if (geteuid() != 0)
00345         {
00346         fprintf(stderr,"This program must be run with root privileges.\n");
00347         exit(1);
00348         }
00349 
00350     err = __xeno_sys_init();
00351 
00352     if (err)
00353         {
00354         fprintf(stderr,"sys_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00355         exit(2);
00356         }
00357 
00358     err = __xeno_skin_init();
00359 
00360     if (err)
00361         {
00362         fprintf(stderr,"skin_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00363         exit(3);
00364         }
00365 
00366     err = __xeno_user_init();
00367 
00368     if (err)
00369         {
00370         fprintf(stderr,"user_init() failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00371         exit(4);
00372         }
00373 
00374     mlockall(MCL_CURRENT|MCL_FUTURE);
00375 
00376     sa.sa_handler = &xnarch_restart_handler;
00377     sigemptyset(&sa.sa_mask);
00378     sa.sa_flags = SA_RESTART;
00379     sigaction(XNARCH_SIG_RESTART,&sa,NULL);
00380 
00381     for (;;)
00382         uvm_thread_idle(&uvm_irqlock);
00383 
00384     __xeno_user_exit();
00385     __xeno_skin_exit();
00386     __xeno_sys_exit();
00387 
00388     exit(0);
00389 }
00390 
00391 #endif  /* !XENO_MAIN_MODULE */

00412 #ifdef XENO_POD_MODULE
00413 
00414 extern void *uvm_timer_handle;
00415 
00416 xnsysinfo_t uvm_info;
00417 
00418 xnarchtcb_t *uvm_root;
00419 
00420 xnarchtcb_t *uvm_current;
00421 
00422 struct xnarch_tick_parms {
00423     unsigned long nstick;
00424     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00425     xncompletion_t completion;
00426 };
00427 
00428 /*
00429  * NOTE: System-level shadow priorities underlying the UVM threads are
00430  * defined as follows:
00431  *
00432  * - uvm-root = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO)
00433  * - uvm-<user> = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 1
00434  * - uvm-timer = prio_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 2
00435  */
00436 
00437 static void *xnarch_timer_thread (void *cookie)
00438 
00439 {
00440     struct xnarch_tick_parms *p = (struct xnarch_tick_parms *)cookie;
00441     void (*tickhandler)(void);
00442     struct sched_param param;
00443     unsigned long nstick;
00444     long err;
00445 
00446     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 2;
00447     sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00448 
00449     /* Copy the following values laid into our parent's stack before
00450        it is unblocked from the completion by uvm_thread_create(). */
00451     tickhandler = p->tickhandler;
00452     nstick = p->nstick;
00453 
00454     uvm_thread_create("uvm-timer",NULL,&p->completion,&uvm_timer_handle);
00455 
00456     err = uvm_thread_barrier(); /* Wait for start. */
00457 
00458     if (!err)
00459         err = uvm_thread_set_periodic(0,nstick);
00460 
00461     if (err)
00462         pthread_exit((void *)err);
00463 
00464     for (;;)
00465         {
00466         if (uvm_thread_wait_period() == -EWOULDBLOCK) /* Timer killed? */
00467             break;
00468 
00469         xnarch_sync_irq();
00470         tickhandler();
00471         }
00472 
00473     pthread_exit(NULL);
00474 }
00475 
00476 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long nstick,
00477                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00478 {
00479     struct xnarch_tick_parms parms;
00480     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00481     pthread_t thid;
00482     int err;
00483 
00484     if (nstick == 0) /* UVM does not provide oneshot timing. */
00485         return -ENODEV;
00486 
00487     /* However, if we use the oneshot timing which is always available
00488        at kernel level so that we can provide a better resolution for
00489        virtual machine. */
00490 
00491     err = uvm_timer_start(0);
00492 
00493     if (err)
00494         return err;
00495 
00496     parms.nstick = nstick;
00497     parms.tickhandler = tickhandler;
00498     parms.completion.syncflag = 0;
00499     parms.completion.pid = -1;
00500 
00501     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00502     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00503 
00504     err = pthread_create(&thid,&thattr,&xnarch_timer_thread,&parms);
00505 
00506     if (err)
00507         return -err;
00508 
00509     err = uvm_thread_sync(&parms.completion);
00510 
00511     if (err == 0)
00512         uvm_thread_start(uvm_timer_handle);
00513 
00514     return err;
00515 }
00516 
00517 static inline void xnarch_leave_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00518 }

00520 static inline void xnarch_enter_root(xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00521 }

00523 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00524                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00525 {
00526     uvm_current = in_tcb;
00527     uvm_thread_activate(in_tcb->khandle,out_tcb->khandle);
00528 }
00529 
00530 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00531                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00532 {
00533     uvm_current = next_tcb;
00534     uvm_thread_cancel(dead_tcb->khandle,next_tcb->khandle);
00535 }
00536 
00537 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00538 
00539 {
00540     uvm_thread_cancel(dead_tcb->khandle,NULL);
00541 }
00542 
00543 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00544                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00545                                          const char *name)
00546 {
00547     struct sched_param param;
00548     int err;
00549 
00550     param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO);
00551     sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00552     err = uvm_system_info(&uvm_info);
00553 
00554     if (err)
00555         {
00556         fprintf(stderr,"UVM init failed: %s\n",strerror(-err));
00557         exit(1);
00558         }
00559 
00560     uvm_thread_shadow("uvm-root",tcb,&tcb->khandle);
00561     tcb->name = name;
00562     uvm_root = uvm_current = tcb;
00563 }
00564 
00565 static void *xnarch_thread_trampoline (void *cookie)
00566 
00567 {
00568     xnarchtcb_t *tcb = (xnarchtcb_t *)cookie;
00569     struct sched_param param;
00570     long err;
00571 
00572     if (!setjmp(tcb->rstenv))
00573         {
00574         param.sched_priority = sched_get_priority_min(SCHED_FIFO) + 1;
00575         sched_setscheduler(0,SCHED_FIFO,&param);
00576         uvm_thread_create(tcb->name,tcb,&tcb->completion,&tcb->khandle);
00577         err = uvm_thread_barrier();     /* Wait for start. */
00578         if (err)
00579             pthread_exit((void *)err);
00580         }
00581 
00582     xnarch_setimask(tcb->imask);
00583 
00584     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->thread);
00585 
00586     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00587 
00588     pthread_exit(NULL);
00589 }
00590 
00591 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00592                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00593                                        void *cookie,
00594                                        int imask,
00595                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00596                                        char *name)
00597 {
00598     pthread_attr_t thattr;
00599     int err;
00600 
00601     if (tcb->khandle)   /* Restarting thread */
00602         {
00603         pthread_kill(tcb->thid,XNARCH_SIG_RESTART);
00604         return;
00605         }
00606 
00607     tcb->imask = imask;
00608     tcb->entry = entry;
00609     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00610     tcb->thread = thread;
00611     tcb->name = name;
00612     tcb->completion.syncflag = 0;
00613     tcb->completion.pid = -1;
00614 
00615     pthread_attr_init(&thattr);
00616     pthread_attr_setdetachstate(&thattr,PTHREAD_CREATE_DETACHED);
00617 
00618     err = pthread_create(&tcb->thid,&thattr,&xnarch_thread_trampoline,tcb);
00619 
00620     if (!err)
00621         uvm_thread_sync(&tcb->completion);
00622     else
00623         xnarch_logerr("pthread_create() failed for thread %s (err %d)\n",name,err);
00624 }

00641 
00642 int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00643 
00644 {
00645     spl_t s;
00646     splhigh(s);
00647     splexit(!!imask);
00648     return !!s;
00649 }

00659 }

00661 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00662 
00663     return 0;
00664 }
00665 
00666 #define xnarch_notify_ready()  /* Nullified */
00667 #define xnarch_notify_shutdown() /* Nullified */
00668 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00669 
00670 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_sys_time(void)
00671 {
00672     struct timeval tv;
00673 
00674     if(gettimeofday(&tv, NULL))
00675         {
00676         printf("Warning, gettimeofday failed, error %d\n", errno);
00677         return 0;
00678         }
00679 
00680     return tv.tv_sec * 1000000000ULL + tv.tv_usec * 1000;
00681 }
00682 
00683 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00688 
00689     tcb->khandle = NULL;
00690 }

00693 #define xnarch_free_stack(tcb)            do { } while(0)

00697 extern xnsysinfo_t uvm_info;
00698 
00699 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long tsc) {
00700 
00701     nanostime_t ns;
00702     return uvm_timer_tsc2ns(tsc,&ns) ? 0 : ns;
00703 }
00704 
00705 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (unsigned long long ns) {
00706 
00707     nanostime_t tsc;
00708     return uvm_timer_ns2tsc(ns,&tsc) ? 0 : tsc;
00709 }
00710 
00711 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void)
00712 
00713 {
00714     nanotime_t t;
00715     uvm_timer_read(&t);
00716     return t;
00717 }
00718 
00719 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_tsc (void)
00720 
00721 {
00722     nanotime_t t;
00723     uvm_timer_tsc(&t);
00724     return t;
00725 }
00726 
00727 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00728     return uvm_info.cpufreq;
00729 }
00730 
00731 static inline void xnarch_halt (const char *emsg) {
00732     fprintf(stderr,"UVM fatal: %s\n",emsg);
00733     fflush(stderr);
00734     exit(99);
00735 }
00736 
00737 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes) {
00738     return malloc(bytes);
00739 }
00740 
00741 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes) {
00742     free(chunk);
00743 }
